comments.body:
With this change, we only parse the directive section of dart sources to figure out the dependencies.  This syntax error was technically after the directive section and is therefore ignored by the new DartDependencySetBuilder. Introducing the import statement makes the syntax error part of the directive section.

Now you might ask: "But what about syntax errors after the directive section during hot reload?" After the changed sources are pushed to device they are parsed (again) by the Dart VM on device, which will provide a clear and actionable error message if it encounters any syntax errors. So, everything is good here as well.

The old sky_snapshot based system would detect many syntax errors beyond imports on the host and not send it to the device for parsing. I think it's fine trading faster hot reload times for more device side errors.
Ah that makes sense. I was confused as to which test this is (we have a bevy of tests that verify handling of bad syntax, it turns out.)
